speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: SCENE III. The same. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Enter MARK ANTONY, OCTAVIUS CAESAR, OCTAVIA between them, and Attendants

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The world and my great office will sometimes

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Divide me from your bosom.

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: All which time

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: Before the gods my knee shall bow my prayers

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: To them for you.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Good night, sir. My Octavia,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Read not my blemishes in the world's report:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I have not kept my square; but that to come

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Shall all be done by the rule. Good night, dear lady.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Good night, sir.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Good night.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Exeunt OCTAVIUS CAESAR and OCTAVIA

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Enter Soothsayer

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Now, sirrah; you do wish yourself in Egypt?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Would I had never come from thence, nor you Thither!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: If you can, your reason?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: I see it in

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: My motion, have it not in my tongue: but yet

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Hie you to Egypt again.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Say to me,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Whose fortunes shall rise higher, Caesar's or mine?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Caesar's.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Therefore, O Antony, stay not by his side:

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Thy demon, that's thy spirit which keeps thee, is

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Noble, courageous high, unmatchable,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Where Caesar's is not; but, near him, thy angel

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Becomes a fear, as being o'erpower'd: therefore

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Make space enough between you.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Speak this no more.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: To none but thee; no more, but when to thee.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: If thou dost play with him at any game,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Thou art sure to lose; and, of that natural luck,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: He beats thee 'gainst the odds: thy lustre thickens,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: When he shines by: I say again, thy spirit

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Is all afraid to govern thee near him;

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: But, he away, 'tis noble.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Get thee gone:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Say to Ventidius I would speak with him:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exit Soothsayer

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: He shall to Parthia. Be it art or hap,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: He hath spoken true: the very dice obey him;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And in our sports my better cunning faints

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Under his chance: if we draw lots, he speeds;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: His cocks do win the battle still of mine,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: When it is all to nought; and his quails ever

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Beat mine, inhoop'd, at odds. I will to Egypt:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And though I make this marriage for my peace,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I' the east my pleasure lies.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter VENTIDIUS

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: O, come, Ventidius,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: You must to Parthia: your commission's ready;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Follow me, and receive't.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exeunt
